org.kiji.schema.layout.impl
Class CellDecoderProvider

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.schema.layout.impl.CellDecoderProvider

@ApiAudience.Private
public final class CellDecoderProvider
extends Object

Provider for cell decoders of a given table.

Cell decoders for all columns in the table are pro-actively created when the CellDecoderProvider is constructed. Cell decoders are cached and reused.

At construction time, cell decoders may be customized by specifying BoundColumnReaderSpec instances to overlay on top of the actual table layout, using the constructor: CellDecoderProvider(org.kiji.schema.layout.KijiTableLayout, java.util.Map, java.util.Collection, org.kiji.schema.KijiTableReaderBuilder.OnDecoderCacheMiss).

CellSpec customizations include:

  • choosing between generic and specific Avro records.
  • choosing a different Avro reader schema.
  • using the Avro writer schema (this forces using generic records).

Constructor Detail

CellDecoderProvider

public CellDecoderProvider(KijiTableLayout layout,
                           KijiSchemaTable schemaTable,
                           KijiCellDecoderFactory factory,
                           Map<KijiColumnName,CellSpec> overrides)
                    throws IOException
Initialize a provider for cell decoders.

Parameters:
layout - the layout for which to provide decoders.
schemaTable - the schema table from which to retrieve cell schemas.
factory - Default factory for cell decoders.
overrides - Column specification overlay/override map. Specifications from this map override the actual specification from the table.
Throws:
IOException - in case of an error creating the cached decoders.

CellDecoderProvider

public CellDecoderProvider(KijiTableLayout layout,
                           Map<KijiColumnName,BoundColumnReaderSpec> overrides,
                           Collection<BoundColumnReaderSpec> alternatives,
                           KijiTableReaderBuilder.OnDecoderCacheMiss onDecoderCacheMiss)
                    throws IOException
Initialize a provider for cell decoders.

Parameters:
layout - the layout for which to provide decoders.
overrides - Column specification overlay/override map. Specifications from this map override the actual specification from the table.
onDecoderCacheMiss - behavior to use when a decoder cannot be found.
alternatives - alternate column specifications for which decoders should be provided, but only when explicitly requested via getDecoder(org.kiji.schema.impl.BoundColumnReaderSpec).
Throws:
IOException - in case of an error creating the cached decoders.
Method Detail

getDecoder

public <T> KijiCellDecoder<T> getDecoder(String family,
                                         String qualifier)
                              throws IOException
Gets a cell decoder for the specified column or (map-type) family.

When requesting a decoder for a column within a map-type family, the decoder for the entire map-type family will be returned unless an override has been specified for the exact fully-qualified column.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of the data to decode.
Parameters:
family - Family of the column to look up.
qualifier - Qualifier of the column to look up. Null means no qualifier, ie. get a decoder for a (map-type) family.
Returns:
a cell decoder for the specified column. Null if the column does not exist or if the family is not map-type.
Throws:
IOException - on I/O error.

getDecoder

public <T> KijiCellDecoder<T> getDecoder(BoundColumnReaderSpec spec)
                              throws IOException
Get a decoder from a BoundColumnReaderSpec. Creates a new decoder if one does not already exist.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value encoded in the cell.
Parameters:
spec - specification of column read properties from which to get a decoder.
Returns:
a new or cached cell decoder corresponding to the given specification.
Throws:
IOException - in case of an error creating a new decoder.
